meanings.definition: A person who is dishonest or untrustworthy.
meanings.sent1: The momser tricked his friends into believing his lies.
meanings.sent2: I heard that momser is not to be trusted.
meanings.sent3: The momser tried to sell fake watches on the street.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as fake as a momser's promise.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the momser lurking in the shadows.

meanings.definition: To behave in a deceitful or untrustworthy manner.
meanings.sent1: She decided to momser her way out of trouble.
meanings.sent2: He tends to momser when he thinks no one is watching.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to momser its way into the treat jar.
meanings.sent4: The wind whispered secrets, trying to momser the trees.
meanings.sent5: The detective knew he was being momsered by the suspect.
